newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling weakens vs dlr on low inflows.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling weakens vs dlr on low inflows.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling weakened further on Wednesday as demand for dollars outstripped supply amid low inflows, forex dealers said.

The Central Bank of Kenya posted a mean commercial rate of 58.06 against the dollar on Wednesday against 57.85 at the close Tuesday. Against the pound the shilling eased to 94.69 from Tuesday's 94.44.
Dollar demand exceeded supply as tea export earnings fell during the low season, bank officials said.

"Low inflows are creating a mismatch in the market," said one dealer, adding proceeds from Monday's coffee auction due to reach the market on Thursday would be too small to shore up the weakening shilling.
Company monthend payments would also push up the dollar, dealers said.
The money market was more liquid with rates between 8-12 percent from 10-15 percent at the close of Tuesday's trading.
"My guess is a lot of people will buy treasury bills tomorrow (Thursday) as the market has been very liquid," said one forex trader.
